title: Walks around Holt Wiltshire Walking Route

images.title: Brian Robert Marshall / Holt The Walk, Courts Gardens, Holt, Wiltshire
images.caption: Holt The Walk, Courts Gardens, Holt, Wiltshire

images.title: David Anstiss / The Courts House from the Entrance Gate
images.caption: The Courts House from the Entrance Gate. The house was built in 1720 was the home of a wealthy clothier from nearby Bradford-on-Avon, at the time a prosperous wool town. It served as the village law court where cloth weavers could settle their disputes.

images.title: David Anstiss / Hot Border in The Courts Garden
images.caption: Hot Border in The Courts Garden View towards Holt Church in background. House is to right of photo.

images.title: Derek Harper / The Old Ham Tree Inn, Ham Green
images.caption: The Old Ham Tree Inn, Ham Green

images.title: Great Chalfield Manor gardens by Stuart Logan, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Great Chalfield Manor gardens

images.title: Trish Steel, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Great Chalfield Manor and Church. The church is dedicated to All Saints and was built during the 14th, 15th and late 18th centuries and restored in 1914 by C H Biddulph-Pinchard.

images.title: Derek Harper / Great Chalfield Manor
images.caption: Great Chalfield Manor. "Here is one of the most perfect examples of the late medieval English manor house" says Pevsner ("Wiltshire", 1963).

images.title: Trish Steel, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Arched Gateway at Great Chalfield Manor. Manor house and associated buildings were built between 1465-1460 for Thomas Tropnell and restored between 1905-12 by Sir Harold Brakspear for Robert Fuller. The building is Grade I listed. The property was given to the National Trust in 1943.

description: This worthy Wiltshire village is located close to Bradford on Avon, Trowbridge Park and Melksham in an attractive part of the county. Walking highlights include the nearby Kennet and Avon Canal, the River Avon and two fine National Trust properties located in an around the village. This walk from the village visits the National Trust's Courts Garden before heading north to visit Great Chalfield Manor. The two sites are great for a peaceful stroll in beautiful, historical surroundings. The walk starts in the village where you can explore the beautiful Courts Garden. Here you'll find water gardens, herbaceous borders and some beautifully crafted topiary. The route then follows footpaths north to Great Chalfield where you'll find a fine medieval manor house surrounded by lovely gardens. There's terraces, topiary houses, a gazebo and a lily pond to see here.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Head to the Old Ham Tree for some post walk refreshments. The 18th century pub is located in a nice spot close to the village green. They serve quality dishes which you can enjoy a pleasant garden area. You can find them at postcode BA14 6PY.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south west and you can enjoy easy waterside walks along the Kennet and Avon Canal and the River Avon in Bradford on Avon. To the north west there's the worthy village of Monkton Farleigh where you can explore the attractive estate of the 18th century Monkton Farleigh Manor House. The circular walk also visits South Wraxall with its 15th century manor house. Just to the north west of the village you can climb to Bathford Hill and visit Brown's Folly. The 19th century tower is surrounded by a nature reserve with woodland, wildlife and countryside views.  For more walking ideas in the area see the Wiltshire Walks page.

display_address: The Star, Holt, Wiltshire, England, BA14 6QB, United Kingdom
